leads.lead_text: Surface of stem segments minutely pubescent (hairs 0.3–0.8 mm long) or muricate (projections to 0.1 mm long)
Surface of stem segments glabrous
Stem segments minutely pubescent
Stem segments minutely muricate
Spreading shrub to 1 m high, often somewhat creeping; spines absent; mature stem segments usually mid green; inner tepals yellow

Shrub 1.5–3 (–4.5) m high or tree-like to 8 m high; spines absent (if absent, then inner tepals orange and tinged red) or 1 or 2 per areole or present on all but the lowest areoles on the stem segment; mature stem segments green or grey-green; inner tepals yellow or orange
Stem segments obovate to broad elliptic, 9–20 cm long, (3.5–) 5–10 cm wide; fruit 5–7 cm long, 2–3 cm diam.
Stem segments narrow linear-elliptic to oblong, 20–35 cm long, 3–6 cm wide; fruit 2.5–3.5 cm long, c. 1.5 cm diam.
Stem segments subcylindric to cylindric, easily detached, glossy
Stem segments laterally compressed, firmly attached (or easily detached in O. aurantiaca), dull or glossy (O. aurantiaca, O. bonaerensis, O. monacantha)
Stem segments 1.5–4 cm wide, easily detached, glossy
Stem segments > 5 cm wide, firmly attached, dull or glossy (O. bonaerensis, O. monacantha)
Spines absent or mostly 1 (rarely 2 in O. monacantha) per areole on stem segments, usually confined to upper half of stem segments, or long margin of stem segement, or irregulaly dispersed
Spines mostly 2–12 per areole on most areoles on stem segments
Stem segments spineless
At least some stem segments bearing spines
Glochids on stem segments inconspicuous, 0.5–1.5 mm long; pericarpel tuberculate at anthesis; stem segments 20–50 mm thick; areoles 30–75 per stem segment face; inner tepals yellow to orange
Glochids on stem segments conspicuous, 2–10 mm long; pericarpel smooth at anthesis; stem segments 12–25 mm thick; areoles 10–40 per stem segment face; inner tepals yellow
Spines on stem segments pliable, 4–19 mm long, 0.5–0.7 mm wide at base; fruit ovoid to ellipsoid, tuberculate; stem segments dull green, grey-green or glaucous
Spines on stem segments rigid (when present), 12–40 (–60) mm long, 0.5–1.5 wide; fruit narrow-obovoid, obovoid, obconic, ovoid to pyriform; stem segments mid green to grey-green, glossy or dull
Stem-segments 20–28 (–40) mm thick; spines dark red-brown or reddish purple with yellowish apex (ageing greyish brown or pale grey); inner tepals orange
Stem segments to 20 mm thick; spines yellow, white to brown with yellow or red markings (rarely spines all reddish); inner tepals yellow
Stem segments dull green or grey-green; pericarpel scales and outer tepals green or yellowish, at most red tinged; mature fruit purple
Stem segments mid green, glossy; pericarpel scales and outer tepals uniformly red; mature fruit green with red-purple shades
Spines  on stem segments deflexed, at least the longer spines on the face of the stem segment (spines on the margin and at apex of stem segment can be spreading)
Spines on stem segments erect or spreading in all directions
Spines on stem segments mottled yellow and red-brown, ageing brown; inner tepals deep red or orange-red or orange-pink, only slightly spreading; filaments pink; style red
Spines on stem segments yellow or white, ageing white, grey or brown; inner tepals yellow or orange (sometimes in O. streptacantha); filaments yellow; style white to pale yellow
Stem segments mostly orbicular, blue-green glaucous; areoles 25–40 per stem segment face; glochids 2–6 mm long on stem segments; pericarpel with 3 or 4 tubercles in a diagonal line
Stem segments obovate to broad-obovate, green, grey-green or glaucous; areoles 30–100 per stem segment; glochids 0.5–1.5 mm long on stem segments; pericarpel with 5–7 tubercles in a diagonal line
Spines mottled yellow and red-brown, ageing brown; inner tepals deep red or orange-red or orange-pink, only slightly spreading; filaments pink; style red

Spines yellow, white, brown, red-brown or tan, ageing white, grey, brown or black; inner tepals yellow or orange (sometimes in O. ficus-indica, O. streptacantha), usually widely spreading; filaments yellow; style white to pale yellow or pale pinkish

Stem segments usually 4–15 (–25 ) cm long, 2–8 (–12) cm wide, 5–10 mm thick; areoles 5–12 mm apart; spines largely covering the stem segments (i.e. obscuring the surface); typically spreading shrub < 1 m high
Stem segments usually larger, 10–60 cm long, 7–42 cm wide, 12–50 mm thick; areoles 20–50 mm apart; spines usually not covering the stem segments; erect shrubs or tree-like to 5 m high

Fruit barrel-shaped, lacking stalk-like base, tuberculate (only slightly so in O. streptacantha); inner tepals yellow to orange; plants often producing a well-developed trunk (only sometimes in O. robusta) to 1 m high
Fruit obovoid (occasionally barrel-shaped), with stalk-like base, not tuberculate; inner tepals yellow; plants not producing a trunk
Stem segments mostly orbicular, blue-green glaucous; areoles 25–40 per stem segment face; glochids 2–6 mm long on stem segments; pericarpel with 3 or 4 tubercles in a diagonal line
Stem segments obovate to broad-obovate, green, grey-green or glaucous; areoles 30–100 per stem segment; glochids 0.5–1.5 mm long on stem segments; pericarpel with 5–7 tubercles in a diagonal line
Stem segments 25–60 cm long, 20–50 mm thick; fruit yellow, orange, red or carmine; seeds 4–5 mm diam.
Stem segments (10–) 18–35 cm long, 10–20 mm thick; fruit pink to purple; seeds 3–4 mm diam.
